title: SMC_GroupReadPathAcceleration (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK SMC_GroupReadPathAcceleration
This function block returns the path acceleration of an axis group.
Any position or orientation lag (see
PositionLag
and
OrientationLag
outputs of
MC_GroupReadStatus
) is ignored.  The dynamics are evaluated
as if the axis group was following the path exactly.
This is an administrative FB, no movement is generated.

rows.Name: AxisGroup
rows.Comment: Reference to a group of axes

rows.Name: Enable
rows.Comment:
Return the path dynamics of the axis group
in the selected coordinate system while enabled.

rows:
Coordinate system.  Note: for any static coordinate system,
the result will be the same.  For dynamic coordinate systems,
the returned dynamics are relative to this coordinate system
and will depend on the movement of the PCS.
The coordinate system ACS is not allowed.

Determines the source on which the path dynamics is based.
For MC_SOURCE.ACT, the actual value received from the drive
in this bus task cycle is used.  For MC_SOURCE.SAVE, the
value computed in the PLC in the previous cycle is used.
For MC_SORUCE.SET, the value computed in the PLC in this
cycle is used.Note 1: if the set values of the axis group are used
(|MC_SOURCE.SET|), then it is recommended
to callSMC_GroupUpdateand to update any dynamic coordinate systems
before this function block is called.  For example, ifMC_TrackConveyorBeltis used, then the movement function block of
the belt-axis should be called before.

The time offset in seconds when to evaluate the path dynamics.
Must be in [0,fPlanningForecastDuration].fPlanningForecastDurationcan be configured usingSMC_TuneCPKernel.
For time offsets > 0, the output will only beValidiftheSourceis set to|MC_SOURCE.SET|theTimeOffsetdoes not exceed theCurrentPlanningForecastreported byMC_GroupReadStatus.WhileMC_GroupHaltorMC_GroupStopare active, valid path dynamics
can only be obtained for TimeOffset = 0.
Signals that an error has occurred within the function block

Path acceleration of the group in the given coordinate
system
